messages.title: HOW WE WILL PAY FOR OUR PLANS
messages.content: We'll take immediate action to start cutting government waste – things like reducing the £2.5 billion a year the government spends on marketing and communications, the £4.5 billion a year spend on NHS bureaucracy, and the millions given in aid to China – which spent £20 billion hosting the Beijing Olympics.
We've found the money from other areas – like cutting government waste.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Reducing spend on marketing and communications, reducing NHS bureaucracy, and stopping aid to countries like China that can fund large events.
We will tackle benefit fraud, reform the welfare system so that those who can work do work, and we’ll cut benefits for those who won’t work.
We will introduce a new tax on the banks following their taxpayer bailout.
We will cut the deficit faster than Labour – so we don’t have to spend as much on interest payments.

issues.economy: We'll cut the deficit faster than Labour – so we don’t have to spend as much on interest payments.
issues.governance: We'll take immediate action to start cutting government waste.
issues.health: Reducing £4.5 billion a year spend on NHS bureaucracy.
issues.socialWelfare: We will tackle benefit fraud, reform the welfare system so that those who can work do work, and we’ll cut benefits for those who won’t work.

quotes.text: We have bold plans to change our country for the better. Some of these plans won’t cost money but will require real energy – like our determination to improve school discipline. And where our plans will cost more money, like stopping Labour’s jobs tax, we’ve found the money from other areas – like cutting government waste.

images.caption: David Cameron at a podium speaking.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet promotes austerity measures, efficiency in government spending, and welfare reforms.
